alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 10:08PM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Perryville For the Tennessee River...including PICKWICK DAM HEADWATER, Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 362.5 feet, In Decatur County, water begins to inundate the boat launch area on Woodlawn Shores Road in Cherokee Heights. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 361.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 362.3 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Action stage is 362.0 feet. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
